primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God defines Himself through historical intervention to deliver His people from bondage, culminating in the Cross.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is the One who brought Israel up out of the land of Egypt.
He has entered the battle against Satan on our side and has shown himself to be the conqueror.
God is the one who acts. He is a verb more than he is a noun.

object.identificatie: Salvation/Deliverance of humanity from bondage and idolatry
tekstueel_bewijs: gave us his very self for our salvation

zender.identificatie: God's own nature/character (I am who I am)
tekstueel_bewijs: He has done it because he is who he is.
bestows his riches upon all who call upon him
deliver his children from bondage into freedom
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is the passive Receiver of God's action, not the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Word, Sacraments, and the specific history of Israel
tekstueel_bewijs: God who is present in the Word and Sacraments
The living faith is passed on from one generation to the next.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the active agent (Subject-as-Helper).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power through which the Word becomes 'near'.

tekstueel_bewijs: The temptations of the evil one
Americans now want to create God according to our own preferences.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'definitive battle' against Satan and the ontological power of sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer in worship and offering.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Worshiper
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The offering is a response to what God has already given ('which thou, O Lord, hast given me').

voorbeelden_god_subject: God brought us out of Egypt.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We come to know what God’s way is.
We do not need to redefine God.

voorbeelden: We must go with him all the way to the Cross.
Americans now want to create God according to our own preferences.
How do we know what God’s way is?
Jesus was able to resist sin and evil.
God comes to us with a power that is not our own.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Power to do' (Pouvoir-faire) what man cannot, establishing a theology of divine agency.

primaire_tegenstelling.niet_s2: The Scandal of the Cross (Objective History)

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Gladiator/Marketplace) to ~S1 (Redefining) to S1 (The Credo) and finally to the resolution in the Cross.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God is not found through human searching (~S2) but through His own descent into history (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; idolatry is presented as a pervasive cultural 'air we breathe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the Subject of the action and the source of power, treating human response as a secondary consequence.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in Civil Rights mention
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Hosea Williams and other young black leaders were leading mass meetings.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is a verb more than he is a noun.
God has not yoked himself to us... because we have sought him. He has done it because he is who he is.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Jacob (Aramean) are used to show God's faithfulness, not as moral templates for imitation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already uses a theocentric reading: God is the one who acts upon these figures.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance; the burden of 'defining God' or 'saving oneself' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God's action is the sole cause of deliverance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative moves seamlessly from the Old Testament Credo to the Temptation of Christ to the hearer's current 'Egypt'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'God of the genes' and the 'God of the Cross'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has entered the battle against Satan on our side and has shown himself to be the conqueror.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the objective work of the Son and the Father's presence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'bondage' and 'Satanic temptation' that requires a 'mighty hand' to break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric narrative structure where God is the Subject and man is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a Lenten opening.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Could slightly increase the 'Devoir' (response) in the conclusion to ground the ethics of the 'first fruits'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's act) correctly precedes and grounds Ethics (Our offering).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful sermon that avoids the trap of moralism by relentlessly making God the subject of every significant verb.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Gladiator' hook, Greimas reveals that the hook serves to establish the 'Opponent' (Idolatry).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Aramean; Greimas explains why the Aramean's story functions as a 'Transmission Axis' for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'scandal of particularity' is actually a shift in the 'Sender' actant from 'Human Preference' to 'Divine Self-Definition'.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon uses the 'Ancient Credo' as a narrative engine to displace the hearer from the center of the story.
